eitsupi opened a new pull request #12541:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12541


   Continuing work on #12531.
   Activate the opt-in Bootstrap5 template and add the pkgdown built-in search functionality.
   
   The multi-level menu to select articles from the navigation bar was found to break the navigation bar and is replaced by the default setting of pkgdown.
   
   It seems that extra.js, which realized the arrow package version selector at the time of bs3, cannot handle bs5, and both the version selector and search bar are currently not functioning.
   
   **ToDo**
   
   - [ ] Fix extra.js
   


--

eitsupi opened a new pull request, #12541:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12541

   Continuing work on #12531.
   Activate the opt-in Bootstrap5 template and add the pkgdown built-in search functionality.
   
   The multi-level menu to select articles from the navigation bar was found to break the navigation bar and is replaced by the default setting of pkgdown.
   
   It seems that extra.js, which realized the arrow package version selector at the time of bs3, cannot handle bs5, and both the version selector and search bar are currently not functioning.
   
   **ToDo**
   
   - [ ] Fix extra.js

fields.description:
Enable Bootstrap 5 in pkgdown website to use the built-in search feature.
Do you have any plans to switch to Bootstrap 5?

https://pkgdown.r-lib.org/articles/search.html
https://pkgdown.r-lib.org/articles/customise.html

comments.body: It's not something I've seen discussed, though I can't think of any strong reasons not to do this, other than it breaking things, which can be tested by building the site locally with Bootstrap 5 and checking everything works.  Fancy submitting a PR?

I tried it and the navigation bar was completely broken.

!bs5.png|width=458,height=307!

Perhaps there is a project-wide agreement on the look and feel, and I doubt I can adjust it.

After some trial and error, I noticed that the GitHub icon disappeared from the right side of the navbar in version 3.0.0.

Some changes made between versions 2 and 3 may have broken the navbar.

!image-2022-03-01-00-33-12-050.png|width=478,height=60!

!image-2022-03-01-00-46-51-350.png|width=486,height=70!

[~eitsupi] The lack of GitHub icon is independent of any changes you've made here, so I wouldn't worry about that - I don't think that's something worth fixing.  Versions 2 and 3 may just have been built using different versions of pkgdown or different configurations (we don't rebuild old versions of docs, we just host the archived versions).

Hmm, one of the things which, [according to the docs|https://pkgdown.r-lib.org/articles/customise.html], upgrading Bootstrap can interfere with is custom CSS, so that may be what is happening here.  I'm not sure exactly how the CSS for the nav bar is controlled, but I have built it locally myself previously and ended up with the black version, so it may be that other changes would be required to successfully upgrade here.

The reason why the GitHub icon disappeared was because "home" was no longer auto-detected by this change.
https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9196/files#diff-775785e90c2f47b5b2a6ea925db69564a7c109d593fd8f8383b0b40e8368a1aaR157-R159
https://pkgdown.r-lib.org/reference/build_site.html?q=google#source-repository

Unfortunately it has nothing to do with the navbar corruption.

I was able to fix the broken nav bar, but the dropdown list for version selection is not working.
I may not be able to fix this part as I don't understand JavaScript, but can I submit a PR at this stage and ask others to fix this dropdown list?

!fixed-bs5.png|width=589,height=237!

You're welcome to open a PR but it might end up getting stale if nobody works on it.  FWIW I'm the original author of the JS code that creates the dropdown list and I'm not likely to fix it on your PR any time soon as I'm working on other things right now and this isn't a priority for me, but I am happy to point out where the code is you'd need to update to fix it, and to where you can find resources to learn some JavaScript.

I have confirmed that the search bar does not work when extra.js is present, so extra.js may need to be completely rewritten.

I will submit a PR with all the parts except extra.js fixed and with bootstrap5 disabled so that the existing site functionality can be used.
This allows we to use the functions of the existing site, and if you can rewrite extra.js later, you can enable bootstrap5.

Sorry, I'm a bit confused, would you mind clarifying; if the PR doesn't enabled bootstrap5, then what is actually going to be in it?  When you say "the existing site functionality can be used", what specific things are you referring to?

I apologize for not being clear. The current extra.js that implements the version selector does not work on bootstrap5 templates.
So I will submit a PR that fixes the non-functioning parts of the bootstrap5 template except for extra.js, while leaving bootstrap5 disabled.
Of course, the searchbar will not work because bootstrap5 is disabled.
Specifically, only the part of the _pkgdown.yml lines that does not work with bootstrap5 templates (the cause of the broken navbar I posted) should be fixed.
Right, I see, thanks for clarifying! :)

I create a PR [https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12531]

This change will change the appearance of the articles list as follows, but the nav bar will not be broken when we update to bootstrap5.

!updated-list.png|width=385,height=310!
